text: Not a resource, just some advice: Write your intro after you've written the rest of your piece - it'll help you with your framing and means you're not trying to do your writing to fit the intro :+1:

elements.text: Not a resource, just some advice: Write your intro after you've written the rest of your piece - it'll help you with your framing and means you're not trying to do your writing to fit the intro

text: Check out posts on Smartblogger. Leading with empathy shows your reader that you GET them and you aren’t going to give them the same recycled advice that they’ve heard over and over again.

text:
Hi everyone! :wave::skin-tone-2: I’m writing a post on content marketing tools, which got me wondering about the average number of software tools a content marketer uses. (I’m betting it's a lot!) 

If you could share the number of tools you use one a regular basis – this includes SEO, editing, team comms, analysis, etc. – would really appreciate it!

And if you’re open to sharing more, I put out a quick survey here: <https://www.cognitoforms.com/ReferralRock/whatsoftwaretoolsdoyouuseincontentmarketing|https://www.cognitoforms.com/ReferralRock/whatsoftwaretoolsdoyouuseincontentmarketing>  

Thanks in advance!

elements.text: Hi everyone!

I’m writing a post on content marketing tools, which got me wondering about the average number of software tools a content marketer uses. (I’m betting it's a lot!) 

If you could share the number of tools you use one a regular basis – this includes SEO, editing, team comms, analysis, etc. – would really appreciate it!
And if you’re open to sharing more, I put out a quick survey here:
https://www.cognitoforms.com/ReferralRock/whatsoftwaretoolsdoyouuseincontentmarketing
Thanks in advance!

text:
Hi friends! I’m trying to come up with a good label for this section on a page where people can sign up for a live webinar or self-paced email course (this is just dummy copy).

I want these bullets to be able to contain features (what you get, like 1 email for 7 days), _and_ content (what you’ll learn, like those last two bullets). I don’t _*hate*_ “what to expect” but I don’t love it either. Any ideas?

attachments.title: Search listening tool for market, customer & content research - AnswerThePublic
attachments.text: Use our free tool to get instant, raw search insights, direct from the minds of your customers. Upgrade to a paid plan to monitor for new ways that people talk & ask questions about your brand, product or topic.

text: Ignore volume.

elements.text: Ignore volume.

text: Most tools are either way behind and miss emerging content trends, or their volumes are way off, especially for anything under 1k/mo. And even then, at 1k/mo, with 60% clicks, ranking #1 only means you'll get ~150 clicks from that search. PLEASE don't let volume drive your content efforts.

elements.text: Most tools are either way behind and miss emerging content trends, or their volumes are way off, especially for anything under 1k/mo. And even then, at 1k/mo, with 60% clicks, ranking #1 only means you'll get ~150 clicks from that search. PLEASE don't let volume drive your content efforts.

text: Hey there, everyone. Who has best practices to share around collecting testimonials for an enterprise? I'm wondering how best to assemble, organize and tag them and also make them available to people on other teams. A Google Sheet people can't edit? Something in Salesforce (where we actually collect them)? Airtable?

elements.text: Hey there, everyone. Who has best practices to share around collecting testimonials for an enterprise? I'm wondering how best to assemble, organize and tag them and also make them available to people on other teams. A Google Sheet people can't edit? Something in Salesforce (where we actually collect them)? Airtable?

text: I suppose it depends on how you want to share them. Airtable does has some excellent features that allow form input, "back office" editing, tagging, etc., followed by sharing some or all of the data back out in many forms. Would probably want some sort of automation to SF if that's the core CRM/source of truth in that situation though
